pageProps.contentHtml:
Jensen's formula

Find all entire functions f ⁣:C→C\func{f}{\C}{\C}f:C→C that satisfy the following two properties:

  1. ∣f(z)∣≤e∣z∣2\abs{f\p{z}} \leq e^{\abs{z}^2}∣f(z)∣≤e∣z∣2 for all z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C,
  2. f(n1/3)=nf\p{n^{1/3}} = nf(n1/3)=n for all n∈Nn \in \Nn∈N.

Hint: f(z)=z3f\p{z} = z^3f(z)=z3 is one of them.
Solution.

Let fff be such a function, and let m≥0m \geq 0m≥0 be such that

g(z)=f(z)−z3zmg\p{z} = \frac{f\p{z} - z^3}{z^m}g(z)=zmf(z)−z3​

is still entire. Notice that ggg is still entire of second order and that

g(n1/3)=f(n1/3)−nnm/3=0g\p{n^{1/3}} = \frac{f\p{n^{1/3}} - n}{n^{m/3}} = 0g(n1/3)=nm/3f(n1/3)−n​=0

for all n∈Nn \in \Nn∈N. Suppose that ggg is not identically zero, so that we may apply Jensen's formula:

log⁡ ∣g(0)∣+∑∣an∣<Rlog⁡R∣an∣=12π∫02πlog⁡ ∣g(Reiθ)∣ dθ≲R2\log\,\abs{g\p{0}} + \sum_{\abs{a_n} < R} \log\frac{R}{\abs{a_n}} = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \log\,\abs{g\p{Re^{i\theta}}} \,\diff\theta \lesssim R^2log∣g(0)∣+∣an​∣<R∑​log∣an​∣R​=2π1​∫02π​log∣∣​g(Reiθ)∣∣​dθ≲R2

where ana_nan​ denotes the zeroes of ggg. Then because each n1/3n^{1/3}n1/3 is a root,

R2≳∑n1/3<Rlog⁡Rn1/3≳∑n<R3log⁡RR1/3≳⌊R3⌋log⁡R,\begin{aligned} R^2 &\gtrsim \sum_{n^{1/3} < R} \log\frac{R}{n^{1/3}} \\ &\gtrsim \sum_{n < R^3} \log\frac{R}{R^{1/3}} \\ &\gtrsim \floor{R^3} \log{R}, \end{aligned}R2​≳n1/3<R∑​logn1/3R​≳n<R3∑​logR1/3R​≳⌊R3⌋logR,​

which is impossible. Hence, ggg must have been identically zero to begin with, i.e., f(z)=z3f\p{z} = z^3f(z)=z3, so z3z^3z3 is the only such function.
